metadata.Title: CVE-2002-2439 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
operator new[] sometimes returns pointers to heap blocks whichare too small.  When a new array is allocated, the C++ run-timehas to calculate its size.  The product may exceed the maximumvalue which can be stored in a machine register.  This error isignored, and the truncated value is used for the heap allocation.This may lead to heap overflows and therefore security bugs.(See http://cert.uni-stuttgart.de/advisories/calloc.php for furtherreferences.)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2002-2439` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cpp-4.8 - 4.8.2-19ubuntu1
g++-4.8 - 4.8.2-19ubuntu1
g++-4.8-multilib - 4.8.2-19ubuntu1
gcc-4.8 - 4.8.2-19ubuntu1
gcc-4.8-base - 4.8.2-19ubuntu1

gcc-snapshot - 20140405-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gcc-4.8 package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.2-19ubuntu1').
gcc-snapshot package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20140405-0ubuntu1').
gcc-arm-none-eabi package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-h8300-hms package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-mingw-w64 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-msp430 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
